edu.utah.cdmcc.dao
Class PatientDAOHibernate

java.lang.Object
  edu.utah.cdmcc.dao.GenericHibernateDAO<Patient,java.lang.Long>
      edu.utah.cdmcc.dao.PatientDAOHibernate
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGenericDAO<Patient,java.lang.Long>, IPatientDAO
public class PatientDAOHibernate
extends GenericHibernateDAO<Patient,java.lang.Long>
implements IPatientDAO

This handles all patient creation routines, utilizing the Hibernate interface. It also handles deletion of patients. Patient objects are validated by the Hibernate validator, and then the object is made persistent to assure its storage in the database.

Author:
J. Michael Dean, M.D., M.B.A.

addPatient

public boolean addPatient(Patient newPatient)
Routine to add a new patient to the database; Checks for duplicate TrialDB number and invalid fields based on Hibernate validator object.

Specified by:
addPatient in interface IPatientDAO
Returns:
Boolean to indicate whether patient was added (True) or not (False).

createPatient

public boolean createPatient(Patient newPatient)
Routine creates a new patient. The patient object (newPatient) is validated against a Hibernate ClassValidator, checked for whether it already exists in the database, and the return parameter determines success of the operation.

Specified by:
createPatient in interface IPatientDAO
Parameters:
newPatient -
Returns:
Boolean to indicate if patient was created (True) or failed to be created (False).

deletePatient

public void deletePatient(Patient patient)
Routine to delete a patient. This routine brings up a message dialog to confirm that the user wants to delete the object. The deletion is not reversible.

Specified by:
deletePatient in interface IPatientDAO
Parameters:
patient -

deletePatientWithoutWarning

public void deletePatientWithoutWarning(Patient patient)
Deletes a patient without a warning dialog for the user. This method is public primarily for testing. Programmers should use deletePatient because that routine posts a dialog.

Specified by:
deletePatientWithoutWarning in interface IPatientDAO
Parameters:
patient -

getPatientByTrialDB

public Patient getPatientByTrialDB(java.lang.String trialDbNumber)
Routine to return the patient, if any, that has the specified Trial DB number. If more than one patient has the same number, this routine will fail dismally, meteors will descend on earth, and time will end.

Specified by:
getPatientByTrialDB in interface IPatientDAO
Parameters:
trialDbNumber -
Returns:
Patient with the specific Trial DB number (unique per patient)

trialDBNumberAlreadyExists

public boolean trialDBNumberAlreadyExists(java.lang.String trialDbNumber)
Routine to determine if a Trial DB number has already been used. If this is the case then the number cannot be used again.

Specified by:
trialDBNumberAlreadyExists in interface IPatientDAO
Parameters:
trialDbNumber -
Returns:
Boolean to indicate if the TrialDb number is already used (True) or is new (False)

updatePatient

public boolean updatePatient(Patient patient)
Routine to update patient, fire property changes, and make sure that the update does not violate validation requirements for the patient object. This routine fires a message dialog if there is a failure.

Specified by:
updatePatient in interface IPatientDAO
Parameters:
patient -
Returns:
Boolean to indicate if patient was updated (True) or failed to be updated (False).
